Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid; interior glazed black with pairs of narrow bands in added red at top and bottom of sherd; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of panther (head with added white, red neck, shoulder, part of torso and front legs with red and white and part of tail remaining), to right; part of another figure on right (black with trace of red).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 341, no. B414)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0788) (Phase 1)
